message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.DC, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with algorithms for computing the visibility polygon of a simple polygon, which is a classic problem in computational geometry. Therefore, cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is the most likely sub-category. The algorithms presented in the paper use few working variables, which suggests that they may be related to space-efficient algorithms, placing the paper in the realm of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The randomized and deterministic algorithms presented in the paper may involve probabilistic or combinatorial techniques, respectively, which could place the paper in cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics). The paper may also involve computational complexity analysis, which could place it in cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) or cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
